entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 11:52AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Rising Water Levels on Rivers Draining the Brooks Range... Several weather fronts moving across the Brooks Range will bring rising water levels to rivers and streams. Rainfall totals from 0.75 to 1.75 inches are possible through Friday. Some isolated locations could see higher amounts. At this time, water levels are expected to remain within bank and below flood stage. Those
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northeastern Brooks Range

entry.cap:areaDesc: Northeast Mountains; Okanogan Highlands; Spokane Area; Washington Palouse

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued August 17 at 4:52AM PDT until August 19 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 11 PM PDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Afternoon temperatures in the mid 90s to around 102, with overnight lows in the 60s, in the lower elevations. * WHERE...Holden Village, Lucerne, and Stehekin. * WHEN...From Noon today to 11 PM PDT Friday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Western Chelan County

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued August 17 at 4:52AM PDT until August 19 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 11 PM PDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Afternoon temperatures in the upper 90s to as hot as 104, with overnight lows in the 60s. * WHERE...Loomis, Winthrop, Methow, Carlton, Twisp, Mazama, and Conconully.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Western Okanogan County
